answers.answer: Hello there,May I suggest that you make an appointment with your family doctor.There are a number of things that can cause this. Try and get the appointment as soon as possible. Don't be worried, just make the appointment, see your doctor. I wish you well. Eve

Hello,Causes of post menopausal bleeding could be ovarian cyst fibroids and endometriosis, diseases of pituitary gland, hormonal imbalance of estrogen and progesterone, thyroid hormone imbalance and diabetes. Your doctor may consider tests like blood sugar levels, thyroid function test, prolactin, follicle-stimulating hormone (FSA), estrogen, and testosterone. Imaging studies, such as ultrasound, X-ray, and CT scan or MRI brain may also be recommended in certain individuals.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: I am a 63 yr. old woman.My last period was 16 yr. ago after i had radiation.My problem is I started bleeding again.What could be causing this. I have been bleeding for about a week now ; its been enough that I have to wear a pad.
title: unexpected vaginal bleeding
